TopicTitle: Making a Video game- getting started

Articles.Content:
I am going to make a video game soon . i know basically nothing about making a video game, and i am starting from scratch. I know, the video game will probably not be very good, but i will throw a good amount of effort at it and see what happens. It will be a good experience nonetheless .

I just need a bit of guidance about how to start- what programs to use to program it mainly.

a bit of into about the game:

it will run on the unity engine. it will be slightly similar to the original simcity games, but it will have different (and hopefully better) aspects of gameplay. I am thinking of using c# to program it, but i am not sure if that is the best programming language for a beginner to start with, or if it can do all the things that i intend to do with it.

I'm just wondering if anyone can help me. If you can, you will be very reputationally rewarded.

THANKS!
I'd say the actual coding's the small bit for making a game these days. The big bit is the artwork, so if it's to be a 3d game get to grips with 3d modelling software such as Blender.

Good luck. Hopefully you understand all the code. As in - ALOT of code.

The game "air control" probably had over 1k lines of code in it. Considering a random room generator I made had over 800, in Python. Thats 2d.

Edited August 2, 2014 by TheCanadianVendingMachine

A little advice, don't go completely insane with your first project.

Emulate something with simple mechanics first so you can get the hang of the basics. A SimCity clone will be VERY hard for a first game.
